dcterms:description: Data used to assess shoulder seasons in Texas, specifically the 45 days of lowest total energy use and peak demand in the spring and fall, which are typically used for power plant maintenance.
dcterms:title: ERCOT (Electric Reliability Council of Texas) data

dcterms:description: The ERA5 global reanalysis dataset provides hourly temperature data at a spatial resolution of 0.25° from 1959 onwards, used for assessing temperature trends in relation to electricity demand.
dcterms:title: ECMWF ERA5 (European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts Reanalysis 5)

dcterms:description: Gridded population data used to weight temperature data by population density, influencing energy demand calculations.
dcterms:title: CIESIN (Center for International Earth Science Information Network) population data

dcterms:description: LENS2 is an ensemble of climate model simulations used to predict future temperature trends in the ERCOT service area, particularly under high-emission scenarios.
dcterms:title: LENS2 (Community Earth System Model Large Ensemble Community Project 2)

dcterms:creator: T. Crimmins
M. Crimmins
dcterms:description: Historical temperature data from 1959 to 2022 used to analyze trends in springtime temperatures across the United States, relevant for understanding shifts in electricity demand.
dcterms:title: Historical temperature data (1959-2022)

dcterms:description: Data on electricity demand in Texas, used to analyze trends in peak demand and energy use, particularly in relation to climate change impacts.
dcterms:title: Texas electricity demand data
